intro: Cynoglossum australe var. drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to violet flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a hairy texture, while the flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant landscapes. It is also known for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
